headline: RTX Q1 Earnings Call: Tariff Risks and Solid Execution Shape Outlook
summary: Aerospace and defense company Raytheon (NYSE:RTX) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $20.31 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $83.5 billion at the midpoint came in 0.8% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.47 per share was 7.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates. The stock traded down 5% to $119.78 following the earnings release and call.

headline: Boeing Can Ride the Tariff De-Escalation Tailwind: Heard on the Street
summary: If Donald Trump truly de-escalates his trade war, Boeing could be an early winner.  On top of that, Boeing reported smaller losses and a less onerous cash burn for the first quarter than Wall Street analysts were forecasting.  Comments by GE Aerospace, RTX and Hexcel this week had suggested that the trade war with China could slow production of American-made jets.
